abstract: Yes, the rates are going up -- but it's even worse for large companies.
snippet: Yes, the rates are going up -- but it's even worse for large companies.
lead_paragraph: There's bad news from the workplace: as The New York Times reported on Tuesday, the cost of health insurance rose sharply in 2011 after several years of relatively slow growth. According to the Kaiser Family Foundation's annual survey on employer health benefits, the average premium to insure a family of four grew 9 percent, to just over $15,073. For single coverage, premiums rose 8 percent, to $5,429.

headline.main: For Small Business,  Bad News on Health Care Costs Isn't as Bad
